intro: Sisyrinchium chilense var. uniflorum, commonly known as the Chilean blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a compact growth habit. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland settings.
